timeline.message:
feature(aws-datastore): support conflict unhandled error

It is possible for the local SQLite database to disagree with the
AppSync backend on the state of a given model.

When this occurs, the user may like to provide their own handler, to
suggest a strategy for resolving the conflict.

Previously, a handler interface for this functionality had been added to
the code, however, it was not being called.

feature(aws-datastore): support conflict unhandled error

It is possible for the local SQLite database to disagree with the
AppSync backend on the state of a given model.

When this occurs, the user may like to provide their own handler, to
suggest a strategy for resolving the conflict.

Previously, a handler interface for this functionality had been added to
the code, however, it was not being called.

timeline.author: rjuliano
richardmcclellan

replies.bodyText: Good call. I will do this.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText: Ick... so what's the issue exactly for needing this workaround?
timeline.author: richardmcclellan

replies.bodyText:
In AppSyncMocking, I have a couple of flavors of the mockSuccessResponse(...) which internally create their own Temporal.Timestamp.now(). (So, I can't know what it is, outside, in this unit test.)
However, I just realized that I could test the other flavors of mockSuccessResponse(...), instead -- the ones that will allow me to supply a known timestamp. That would get rid of these kludges and clean things up quite a bit. I'll do that.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.message: FIXUP: address PR feedback from Richard
